item.title: Reimagining Pong Wars with C# and MVUX
item.description: Build a cross-platform Pong Wars game using C# and MVUX with Uno Platform. It dives into the game's architecture, state management, and core mechanics, along with the advantages of immutability for data integrity. Learn how C# markup simplifies UI development, MVUX facilitates state management, and immutable records safeguard data integrity.
item.author: (Uno Platform Team)

After spending more than a decade honing my Android development skills,
item.author:

May 15, 2024 • 5 min read)

item.title: ECMAScript proposal: duplicate named capturing groups for regular expressions
item.description: In this blog post, we take a look at the ECMAScript 2025 feature “Duplicate named capturing groups” which was proposed by Kevin Gibbons. It’s a feature for regular expressions that enables us to use the same capture group name more than once. The only restriction is that duplicates must exist in different alternatives – in other words: At any time, there can’t be more than one capture with a given name. Why is that useful? It lets us reuse regular expression fragments and match-processing code between alternatives.
